intro: Pupalia braunii, commonly known as the Indian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features compound leaves with small, rounded leaflets and produces clusters of small, white or pink flowers. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has a mild, pleasant fragrance. Pupalia braunii prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade.
